info.headline: Flood Advisory issued July 15 at 9:38AM CDT until July 15 at 12:45PM CDT by NWS San Angelo TX
info.description:
* WHAT...Urban and small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected.
* WHERE...A portion of west central Texas, including the following counties, Kimble, Mason and Menard.
* WHEN...Until 1245 PM CDT.
* IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 938 AM CDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. This will cause urban and small stream flooding. Between 0.5 and 1 inch of rain has fallen. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Junction, South Llano River State Park, Yates Crossing, Segovia, London, Saline, Telegraph, Roosevelt, Long Mountain, Fort Mckavett, Cleo, Us-83 Near The Kimble-Menard County Line, The Intersection Of Us-83 And Ranch Road 1773, Us-83 Near The Kerr-Kimble County Line, Us-377 Near The Kimble- Menard County Line, Us-377 Near The Kimble-Edwards County Line, Erna, The Intersection Of I-10 And Us 290, I-10 Near The Kimble-Kerr County Line and Camp Sol Mayer. - This includes Interstate 10 between Mile Markers 434 and 477. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction:
Turn around, don't drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.

parameter.value: FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 1245 PM CDT THIS AFTERNOON

area.areaDesc: Kimble, TX; Mason, TX; Menard, TX
